thread.title: Michelle Obama welcomes POTUS to Twitter with video
thread.title_full: Michelle Obama welcomes POTUS to Twitter with video

title: Michelle Obama welcomes POTUS to Twitter with video
text:
CNN.com
Michelle Obama welcomes POTUS to Twitter with workout video by David E. Wright Updated 0739 GMT (1439 HKT) May 20, 2015 Washington, D.C. (CNN) It looks like Mitt Romney isn't the only one lacing up his boxing gloves . First lady Michelle Obama welcomed President Obama to Twitter Tuesday night with some impressive moves in a slick new workout video, "FLOTUS-style." As part of her Let's Move! program's #Gimmefive challenge, the First Lady showed off five ways to exercise and stay healthy. — The First Lady (@FLOTUS) May 20, 2015 While many have taken the opportunity to greet President Obama's arrival on Twitter: Welcome to @Twitter , @POTUS ! One question: Does that username stay with the office? #askingforafriend — Bill Clinton (@billclinton) May 18, 2015 Good question, @billclinton . The handle comes with the house. Know anyone interested in @FLOTUS ? — President Obama (@POTUS) May 18, 2015 Few have been quite so inspirational. Commemorating the fifth anniversary of the Let's Move! program, the #Gimmefive challenge is an effort to "encourage Americans across the country to give out high-fives when they see someone making healthy choices," and to list five things they are doing "to eat better, be more active, and lead a healthier life," according to the Let's Move! website . First lady Michelle Obama started the Let's Move! initiative five years ago as a way to combat childhood obesity and promote healthy habits. Between jumping rope, lifting weights, and boxing, maybe now we know how Obama got those famously sculpted arms . Your move, POTUS.
